_header: Father and Son and Holy Ghost / Almighty God in Trinity
Subjects: dialogues; Virgin Mary, as speaker in debate; Bernard of Clairvaux, saint
_description: Dialogue between St. Bernard and the Virgin Mary — in 8-line stanzas

BodRawPoe175.First Lines:
FAder & son and haly gastAll mighty god in
                    trinite…
BodRawPoe175.Last Lines:
…And fro þis ground when we sall goþou hald vs fro
                    þe payns of hell
BodRawPoe175.Editions:
Fröhlich,  Walter. 
             De Lamentacione Sancte Marie: Eine englische Dichtung des 14
                Jahrhunderts.
         Leipzig: Heinrich John, 1902: 63.

BLCottTibEVII.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             Yorkshire Writers.
         2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96: 2.274-82.

SionArcL402E25.First Lines:
Fadir and son and halygasteAlle myghty god in
                    Trinite…
SionArcL402E25.Last Lines:
…Why forsakes þou me whyHider I come with þe rede of
                    þe
SionArcL402E25.Note: Corresponding to lines 1-413 only of London,  British Library Cotton Tiberius E.VII.
SionArcL402E25.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
